title: The Great Horned Owl
description: The Great Horned Owl is a large owl native to the Americas, recognizable by the prominent tufts of feathers on its head. It's a highly adaptable and powerful nocturnal predator.

questions.question: What is the primary call of a Great Horned Owl commonly described as?
The Great Horned Owl is a master of silent flight. What allows it to fly so quietly?
options: A special membrane on its wings
Soft, comb-like serrations on the edges of its feathers
Its feathers are made of a special type of lightweight material
It flies at very low altitudes
questions.correct_answer: Soft, comb-like serrations on the edges of its feathers

questions.question: Which of these is a common prey for a Great Horned Owl?
Why are the ear tufts of the Great Horned Owl not actually its ears?
options: They are used for sensing movement

questions.question: What is the collective noun for a group of owls?
